column5:
I got a tattoo when I was 17 over some faint scars on my left forearm to ‚Äústop‚Äù cutting there. Less than 5 years later, I cut on top of that tattoo. I have 2 big ugly scars on it. They ruined the tattoo. Granted, I didn‚Äôt really like it and I regret getting it in the first place more than the actual scars. 

I have several tattoos now on my left arm which I like. Since I got them (2 years ago), I haven‚Äôt cut there anymore. I cut my thighs and stomach instead. Now I really want a thigh tattoo on my left leg but I don‚Äôt want any on my right. That‚Äôs where I prefer to cut.

I‚Äôve done/still do a lot of these. The one that it bothers me the most is that I had a good job and I was very good at it. I did very well the first year and a half. Then I started skipping days, going in late and leaving early. I‚Äôd always got to the ER so I could get a medical rest slip thing (sorry, English is not my main language and I forget what that is called). My work was still good, but I had too many days/hours missing. It started on January, they told me they wouldn‚Äôt renovate my contract on April and that I was to work until the end of May. I still went in late and skipped days. I didn‚Äôt even go on my last day. I hated myself for doing that. I still do. I haven‚Äôt had a job since, that was 2 years ago.
It‚Äôs stupid but one of the things that really bothers me is that he doesn‚Äôt talk me as much anymore. I guess he has other, more important people to talk to. I know I‚Äôm not worth it.
This one is I Am Sober*
3 days for me, too. We got this!

I never wear sleeveless shirts or dresses outside of my house. If I‚Äôm wearing something like that, I always put on a short/long sleeved layer. I do it when the short sleeves are too short too. I would like to have a sleeve tattoo on my left arm. I hope I can get my upper arm filled soon-ish.

I used to self harm for many reasons but one of them was to let myself breathe. I would feel very overwhelmed with emotions, most of them negative and after cutting myself it felt like I could breathe again, it was relaxing too. Of course the guilt would come later and I would feel bad again.
Thank you. It‚Äôs the longest I‚Äôve gone without doing it. I‚Äôm sad that I couldn‚Äôt stop myself tho.
Thank you so much. I‚Äôm trying to stay positive but everything is just so overwhelming right now.

This happens to me all time time. I am jealous of my friends and their clean, smooth arms. I don‚Äôt really think I have deep scars, they are quite visible some of them and I have ugly scar on my forearm. But when I see people with deeper scars it makes me wish I were like that, too.
